Please select a Subject Category.

bind.relevant: ( /Mission_Data_2018/Incident_Outcomes/Number_Sub_Ill_Injured > 0 or /Mission_Data_2018/Incident_Outcomes/Number_Sub_Well > 0 or /Mission_Data_2018/Incident_Outcomes/Number_Sub_DOA > 0) and (selected( /Mission_Data_2018/Incident/Type , 'SEARCH') or selected( /Mission_Data_2018/Incident/Type , 'AIRCRAFT_DOWN/ELT_ACTIVATION') or selected( /Mission_Data_2018/Incident/Type , 'PLB_ACTIVATION') or selected( /Mission_Data_2018/Incident/Type , 'SEND_ACTIVATION'))

bind.jr:requiredMsg: Please indicate the number of found locations
bind.relevant: ( /Mission_Data_2018/Incident_Outcomes/Number_Sub_Ill_Injured > 0 or /Mission_Data_2018/Incident_Outcomes/Number_Sub_Well > 0 or /Mission_Data_2018/Incident_Outcomes/Number_Sub_DOA > 0) and (selected( /Mission_Data_2018/Incident/Type , 'SEARCH') or selected( /Mission_Data_2018/Incident/Type , 'AIRCRAFT_DOWN/ELT_ACTIVATION') or selected( /Mission_Data_2018/Incident/Type , 'PLB_ACTIVATION') or selected( /Mission_Data_2018/Incident/Type , 'SEND_ACTIVATION'))

Please indicate responsiveness and mobility.

Other medical provider must be 500 or fewer characters.
Comment must be 8000 or fewer characters.

input.label:
This is the official 2018 MRA Mission Data Collection Form. The form will ask you a series of questions and location-information related to the type of mission you are reporting. You can also complete the form using the Survey123 Mobile Application.

If you have any questions or experience issues, please write a descriptive email to mramapping@gmail.com.

select1.label: Team Name
select1.hint: Start typing or select from the dropdown. If your team is not in the list, please select "Team Not Listed" and specify below.

item.label: Contra Costa County Sheriff's Search and Rescue
Fresno County Sheriff's Search & Rescue Mountaineering Team
Inyo County Sheriff's Posse Search & Rescue
Las Vegas Metro PD Search & Rescue
Marin County Sheriff’s Search and Rescue Unit
Monterey County Sheriff’s Search and Rescue
Orange County Sheriff's Dept Search and Rescue
Salt Lake County Sheriff's Search & Rescue
San Bernardino Cave & Technical Rescue Team
San Bernardino Mountain Search & Rescue Team
Western State Colorado University Mountain Rescue Team

input.label: Incident Number
input.hint: Please enter the mission number or short name your team uses.

select1.label: Was this a Mutual Aid incident?

input.label: Mutual Aid or State Number
input.hint: (if applicable)

select1.label: Lead Agency
select1.hint: Was your team the lead agency?

select1.label: Type of Incident
select1.hint: Please choose from the list (e.g. Search, Rescue, Training, etc.) or start typing.

input.label: Type of Training
input.hint: Please specify what type of training.

select1.label: Was The Transmitter Accidentally Activated?
select1.hint: Indicate whether the PLB, ELT, or Send device was accidentally activated.

input.label: Incident Start Date and Time
input.hint: Choose an approximate time when the mission was initiated (Earliest action recorded, e.g. 911 phone call, team callout, etc.)

select1.label: Primary Response Area
select1.hint: Was the incident in your primary response area?

input.label: Initial Planning Point
input.hint:
For most missions this is the single best available location where the victim is injured, rescued, or contacted (whichever happened first chronologically and you have an accurate location for). For search operations this is the initial planning point (point last seen or last known point) and then a subsequent 'Found' location is mapped near the end of this survey.

The map pin will stay centered; please drag and zoom the map to position it.

Click on the green map pin icon below the map to change coordinate notation. MGRS is the same as USNG for the purposes of this form.

Please leave the altitude field blank.

input.label: Number of Volunteers Supporting the Incident
input.hint: Estimate the number of volunteer personnel involved (from your team only)

input.label: Total Volunteer Hours on the Incident
input.hint: Estimate and enter a number of volunteer hours (for your team only). This should be at least the length of the operation (hours) multiplied by the number of members that were present for the whole mission.

input.label: Total Volunteer Mileage
input.hint: Estimate the total miles driven by volunteers on this incident.

input.label: Total Paid Staff Hours on the Incident
input.hint: Estimate and enter a number for total paid staff hours. This should be at least the length of the operation (hours) multiplied by the number of members that were present for the whole mission.

select.label: Aircraft Used
select.hint: Indicate any aircraft used for this incident.

input.label: Aircraft Hours
input.hint: Estimate the number of flight hours.

select1.label: Hoist Used
select1.hint: Indicate if a helicopter hoist mechanism was used for this incident.

select1.label: Area Type
select1.hint: Please identify what general type of area this incident occurred in.

select1.label: Land Ownership
select1.hint: Please identify what land ownership type this incident occurred in.

input.label: Total Number of Subjects
input.hint: Enter the total number of subjects needing assistance. For training missions without any real subjects, enter 0.

select1.label: Subject Category
select1.hint: Please choose the best category for the subject(s)

item.label: Child Age 0-15 (If No Other Category Applies)

select.label: Subject 1: Mental Factors
select.hint: Search Operations Only. These fields are used in missing person behavior statistics and can be helpful for reviewing your own missions and pre-planning.

select1.label: Subject 1: Mental Rating
select1.hint: Search Operations Only. These fields are used in missing person behavior statistics and can be helpful for reviewing your own missions and pre-planning.

select1.label: Subject 2: Mental Factors
select1.hint: Search Operations Only. These fields are used in missing person behavior statistics and can be helpful for reviewing your own missions and pre-planning.

select1.label: Subject 2: Mental Rating
select1.hint: Search Operations Only. These fields are used in missing person behavior statistics and can be helpful for reviewing your own missions and pre-planning.

select1.label: Subject 3: Mental Factors
select1.hint: Search Operations Only. These fields are used in missing person behavior statistics and can be helpful for reviewing your own missions and pre-planning.

select1.label: Subject 3: Mental Rating
select1.hint: Search Operations Only. These fields are used in missing person behavior statistics and can be helpful for reviewing your own missions and pre-planning.

select1.label: Subject 4: Mental Factors
select1.hint: Search Operations Only. These fields are used in missing person behavior statistics and can be helpful for reviewing your own missions and pre-planning.

select1.label: Subject 4: Mental Rating
select1.hint: Search Operations Only. These fields are used in missing person behavior statistics and can be helpful for reviewing your own missions and pre-planning.

select1.label: Subject 5: Mental Factors
select1.hint: Search Operations Only. These fields are used in missing person behavior statistics and can be helpful for reviewing your own missions and pre-planning.

select1.label: Subject 5: Mental Rating
select1.hint: Search Operations Only. These fields are used in missing person behavior statistics and can be helpful for reviewing your own missions and pre-planning.

input.label: Group Specifics
input.hint: For a group of more than 5 subjects, please describe relevant ages, gender, fitness, experience, responsiveness, mobility, and mental factors.

input.label: Number of Subjects Found Alive and Well
input.hint: Subjects found in good physical condition

input.label: Number of Subjects Found Ill or Injured
input.hint: Indicate injury and illness details in the next section.

input.label: Number of Subjects Found DOA
input.hint: Subjects found deceased

input.label: How Many 'Found' Locations?
input.hint: Search Operations or Transmitter Activations Only. Please indicate how many separate 'found' locations you would like to record.

input.label: Subject(s) Found
input.hint:
The location where the subject(s) were found.

The map pin will stay centered; please drag and zoom the map to position it.

Click on the green map pin icon below the map to change coordinate notation. MGRS is the same as USNG for the purposes of this form.

Please leave the altitude field blank.

select.label: How Were the Subject(s) Found?
select.hint: For subjects in this location, check all that apply.

input.label: Specify Other for How Subject(s) Were Found
input.hint: Please specify how subject(s) were found.

select.label: Subject Mobility and Responsiveness
select.hint: Were subjects in this location responsive to rescuers and able to travel? Check all that apply.

select1.label: Level of Care Provided to Subject(s)

select.label: Medical Problems: Subject(s)
select.hint: Indicate medical problems encountered with the subject(s). If applicable, check all that apply.

input.label: Specify Other Medical Problems: Subject(s)
input.hint: Specify other medical problems with the subject.

input.label: Number of Team Members Injured or Ill
input.hint: If applicable, indicate the number of team members injured or needing medical attention during this incident.

select1.label: Level of Care Provided to Rescuer(s)

select.label: Medical Problems: Team Member(s)
select.hint: Indicate medical problems encountered with the team member(s). If applicable, check all that apply.

input.label: Specify Other Medical Problems: Team Member(s)
input.hint: Specify other medical problems with the team member.

input.label: Comments
input.hint: Please provide any additional narrative or notes that are important to your team.

input.label: Sending data may take a few seconds after you click 'submit'
